Sergey Pakhomov.title: Anathematized Corpuscles
Sergey Pakhomov.about: The Drones Of Absolem is not a separate project. This is The Dreams Of Absolem, but located on the other side of the same universe. Sort of like a spin-off. Treat both of these names as one. But darker, deeper, more minimalistic. Drone that borders on death industrial and power electronics.

Sergey Pakhomov.title: Black Chapter
Sergey Pakhomov.about:
For 10 years, Train Cemetery has stood out for its special sound. However, in the last couple of years, I have reached a creative crossroad. The project became a hostage to its own sound. I did not see any ways to develop further. Each new track would be a repetition of the previous one, with some nuances.
2024 was one of the hardest years in my life, both in my personal life and in my work. But, in addition to all the troubles, new opportunities opened up. I completely updated my setup, which gave me many new ideas. Train Cemetery found its own path of development. More progressive, more diverse, more multi-level. Progressive wall noise.

Sergey Pakhomov.title: Brutalist
Sergey Pakhomov.about: Dedication to the best architectural style and its authors. Archive album. Recorded in 2018.

Sergey Pakhomov.title: Buried In The Cosmic Silence
Sergey Pakhomov.artist: Train Cemetery & How I met Lauren (with See Through Buildings & Bonechurch)
Sergey Pakhomov.about:
BURIED IN THE COSMIC SILENCE is an international collaborative noise project. The A-side of every issue is an original piece of noise, the B-side is a remix of that piece.
Released on Reason Art Records
reasonartrecords.bandcamp.com/album/buried-in-the-cosmic-silence

Sergey Pakhomov.title: Synth VRN WP-2020: Vitality Test
Sergey Pakhomov.about: To be honest, it wasn't supposed to be The D.O.A. album. At their core, these are test tracks of DIY synthesizer VRN WP-2020 from Vadim Safonov and his Emmett Electronics, for which I developed my own design. But I thought the tracks got pretty interesting. So - here it is ...

Sergey Pakhomov.title: The Mists Of Nothingness
Sergey Pakhomov.about:
Released on LSD Induced Nightmares Records
Thanx so much to Zachary Ledsinger
Follow the link:  lsdinducednightmaresrecords.bandcamp.com/album/the-mists-of-nothingness

Sergey Pakhomov.title: The Mists Of Nothingness (clean version)
Sergey Pakhomov.about: Now I understand that it was a mistake to mix this type of music with a rather harsh static noise. The clean version of the album sounds much more harmonious. Most likely, the development of the project will go in this direction. Clean, simple music with a lot of improvisation. But I want to express my deepest gratitude to Zachary Ledsinger for releasing the previous version of the album on his label LSD Induced Nightmares.

trackinfo.title: The Mists Of Nothingness (clean version)
trackinfo.credits: from The Mists Of Nothingness (clean version), released December 31, 2020

Sergey Pakhomov.title: The Noise
Sergey Pakhomov.about:
Recorded live using Synthcone Breeze (analog therapeutic synthesizer based on 4 noise generators) and 10-band EQ pedal.
